description: Strong bullish reversal candlestick pattern consisting of three consecutive long-bodied green candles with higher closes. Each candle opens within previous candle's body and closes near its high.
validationRules: Each candle has a relatively long body (minimal wicks)
Each candle opens within the previous candle's real body
Candles close near their highs with small upper wicks
Pattern typically forms after a downtrend or at support
invalidationSignals: Fourth candle forms as bearish engulfing or shooting star
Large upper wicks indicating rejection at resistance
Any candle closes below previous candle's low
Pattern forms at major resistance level
commonMistakes: Entering on the third candle without waiting for confirmation
Ignoring resistance levels above the pattern
Not checking for volume increase across the three candles
Confusing with smaller bullish candles - bodies must be substantial
Trading pattern at end of uptrend instead of downtrend

tradeSetup.entry: Open of fourth candle or pullback to support
tradeSetup.stopLoss: Below the low of the first white soldier
tradeSetup.target: Nearest resistance or measured move based on pattern height

supportive: Volume increasing across the three candles
RSI moving from oversold toward neutral/bullish
MACD bullish crossover or positive divergence
Pattern forms at key support level
conflicting: RSI already overbought before pattern completes

confluenceFactors: Aligns with round number support level
